Reviews.Title: Good price not so good as described
Reviews.Author: Stefanos Sotiriou
Reviews.Content: Wireless is very bad! Sometimes stops responding gor a while! Preinstalled skype sucks. Battery life3 aproximately 5 hours in normal use. Touch pad sometimes doesn't do all functions. I would also like it better if the keyboard had light.

Reviews.Title: All functions are good except that sometimes the touchpad would out of work
Reviews.Author: Dan Dong
Reviews.Content: All functions are good except that sometimes the touch pad would out of work.  Both shape and speed are good. Although sometimes the touch pad is out of control.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Carlos Silombria
Reviews.Content: it is really good, excelent hardware.. the island keyboard it is really good.the slim size it is good too, i think the only need is make it of adamantiun. xD

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Kerri-Ann
Reviews.Content: I'm using this Ideapad for programming and  Autocad , its fast  and sleek, i am satisfied with my purchase.Since its not touch screen ,I think its better suited for windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 and accompanying software really makes it slow
Reviews.Author: Yao Zhang
Reviews.Content: It's almost unbearably slow -- typing without seeing the letters appear on your computer for a second, moving the mouse and experiencing lag. My husband had to uninstall MacFee and fixed bunch of settings before it's usable. Still the booting time is long (I think that's more of Windows 8 fault). Battery last about 5 hours. The right shift key is shorter than normal so I often hit the wrong key in the beginning. I wish it has backlit keyboard because when I work beside my sleeping baby, I would turn down the brightness, which also makes it hard to see the keyboard. I suppose you can see the keyboard if you use full brightness. The touch pad is a little sensitive and like to the beginning of the sentence a lot. But it's bearable. I just have to use a real mouse when working on writing tasks.It's look and feel is fairly similar to Mac Pro, I have to say. It's a power house with high CPU power but so far I haven't done any task that would use that kind of power. I'd rather the battery lasted longer. My baby spilled milk on it with the lid closed. So far, it's still working ;-). It feels tough and well-made. The keyboard feels good to type on. Overall I like it.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Micah Wolfe
Reviews.Content: I am a student who was looking for a lightweight laptop that didn't compromise on performance. The start up time is really impressive at 2-3 seconds. This is a really powerful machine for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very good Ultrabook
Reviews.Author: Alfonso GRANA-JONAS
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the IdeaPad U 410 Ultrabook, Isn’t heavy, the 14” display has very good resolution, large keyboard with good space between keys, long life battery (almost reach the lasting time stated in the brochure), in sum is a very dependable piece of technology.

Reviews.Title: Bad experience
Reviews.Author: salim20001
Reviews.Content: Bad battery life, drivers not available. Performance for games are bad. I just bought this product because it said that it's an i7 that runs at 3.1 Ghz

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: jorge m. barrios s.
Reviews.Content: it works really good, it was the best choice for the price and performance. very nice design, totaly recomended for everyone

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop (for me, at least)
Reviews.Author: Andrew Ding
Reviews.Content: I have been using this laptop for a month now. I have installed Ubuntu 13.04, so this review won't address pros and cons of Windows 8.For the most part, this is an excellent laptop. Most things work out nicely, in fact, I only have relatively few complaints:1. There has been two instances where I had trouble connecting to the internet (while others around me could connect). I'm not sure about the source of the problem, but usually restarting helped here for some reason.EDIT: I have had more issues connecting online, mostly inconsistency (that is, disconnecting and reconnecting somewhat frequently). My roommates do not have this issue, so I believe it's due to this laptop.2. There has been two instances where the laptop was overheating, once while charging and once while I was carrying it unplugged. Again, not sure about the source of the problem.3. The battery life probably is not as high as advertised, although Lenovo is not the only company that does this. Battery life really depends on the settings of the computer. If A uses lower brightness settings than B, then A will definitely have a longer battery life. My suggestion to getting more battery life is to turn off Wifi and Bluetooth when you're not using it, and maybe keep the screen brightness at auto-brightness or lower.Overall, I have had few problems with this computer. I am slightly worried about the overheating and wireless issues because they occurred within one month of my purchase, but I think this computer will run well for at least three years.

Reviews.Title: Just Great!
Reviews.Author: JassimQatar
Reviews.Content: This Ultrabook has a really catchy design and very well organized when using it for the first time.I recommend it for everyonne.

Reviews.Title: Chuck
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this laptop. It is light, easy to carry, powerful CPU, bright led screen. And the 24GB SSD improves the speed super fast! I like this laptop very much and would recommend it to every potential buyer!

Reviews.Title: Nice ultrabook
Reviews.Author: Hildo
Reviews.Content: The design is very nice!The start up is amazing, something about 2-3 seconds!The display is very good too!Good weight!Long life battery!Large keyboard with good space between the keys, but unfortunately the keys are not so comfortable as it seems. (bad point)To press the keys F1, F2, F3..etc is necessary to press the Fn (function) key, I didn't like it! I would appreciate if was the opposite. (bad point)Good buy! even with the keyboard "problems".... I recommend!

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: EX
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is the best priced machine with one of the the highest specs. Working perfectly since I purchased it 10 months ago

Reviews.Title: nice computer
Reviews.Author: sharif gindy
Reviews.Content: different from the usual made in China, this computer is very nice, a little heavy for a notebook though..cannot get used to Widows 8

Reviews.Title: What a deal!
Reviews.Author: Robert Schreiber "Web Designer"
Reviews.Content: This is one great computer. Well built and got it at a great price. Fast processor speed, light weight and has more than adequate memory for a laptop. People should check out Amazon's prices before considering TV sites that put the emphasis on the software installed on a computer that is grossly over priced.

Reviews.Title: Chinese manufactured garbage
Reviews.Author: robert greer
Reviews.Content: Check lenovo troubleshooting forums... sooo many issues with u-series and even worse almost no solutions. Had mine for about 5 months, consistently have problems trying to connect to public WiFi. The only WiFi that works is my private network at home. It will connect but is so slow it is useless anywhere else. Also, the stupid touchpad randomly stops working correctly where I can only point and click but cannot scroll or zoom using touchpad. Sometimes it will come back on but it has been about two weeks now since it last worked. Buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: I am fine with product
Reviews.Author: Shoaib Hasan
Reviews.Content: I choose this rating because i like the configuration of the ideapad but i didnt like the operating system Windows 8 in it much. There was no idea with same configuration on WIndows 7. And Lenovo is charging me 100$+ for changing of operating system from Windows 8 to Windows 7 even i bought the ideapad just 2 months ago. Thats very bad.

Reviews.Title: Different from described
Reviews.Author: TheBossIsBack
Reviews.Content: This laptop sucks, it is horrible gaming. And they only give you about 800 gb and the cpu can only run to 2.0. The battery life is very bad, it lasts about 2.5 hours instead of 8 hrs.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo U410
Reviews.Author: Andres Olivares F.
Reviews.Content: The Lenovo U410 Ultrabook is all I expected. It is very fast. I use it for work and personalI recommend it.
